private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labelled blocks: A, E, I, O.
I can move only blocks that are currently on the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final stack from bottom to top is O, N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A with O on the table.

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labelled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N.
I can move only blocks that are currently on the top of a stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that the final stack from bottom to top is O, N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A with O on the table.

orchestrator.goal: Coordinate the two agents to produce a PDDL domain and problem that achieve the target stack O bottom through A top, suitable for the FastDownward solver.

public_information: There are 15 uniquely labelled blocks: A, I, E, H, D, O, K, L, F, M, B, C, G, N, J.
Only the top block of any stack can be moved.
Agents can move only one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to vowels and the other to consonants.
Initial stacks are: Stack1 bottom-to-top A, I, O, F, B, G; Stack2 bottom-to-top E, H, D, K, L, M, C, N, J.
The goal is a single stack with O on the table and then N, M, L, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A above it.

analysis.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. You can only manipulate vowels (A, E, I, O). You may move only top blocks and one block at a time. Provide a clear stepwise analysis that lists which top vowel blocks you can move from the initial configuration, possible intermediate placements you can perform, and any constraints or conflicts with the consonant agent. Do not output PDDL; provide only actionable analysis and a proposed local sequence of moves to assist the orchestrator.

You are consonant_agent. You can only manipulate consonants (B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M, N). You may move only top blocks and one block at a time. Provide a clear stepwise analysis that lists which top consonant blocks you can move from the initial configuration, possible intermediate placements you can perform, and any constraints or conflicts with the vowel agent. Do not output PDDL; provide only actionable analysis and a proposed local sequence of moves to assist the orchestrator.

pddl.system_prompt: You are orchestrator and must produce a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem targeting the FastDownward solver. Integrate the analyses from the agents and the public environment information to generate a single coherent multi-agent-aware PDDL domain and problem that encode agent-specific move capabilities (preserving which agent can move which blocks), top-of-stack constraints, on and on-table predicates, and the target final stack. Keep actions distinct for each agent (for example move-vowel and move-consonant or similar naming) and include any necessary typing and requirements for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If some information is missing from the agents' analyses, do not invent additional agent capabilities; only use what is in their private information and the public information.
pddl.prompt: Use the public environment information: {environment->public_information}. Use the agents' private information: vowel_agent: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}; consonant_agent: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Use the analyses from the agents: {analysis_vowel} and {analysis_consonant}. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that will allow FastDownward to find a plan to reach the global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Enclose domain and problem as specified.
